title: Describe Type II error given hypotheses

content.description:
A statistical test involves the following null and alternative hypotheses.

<math alttext="H sub 0, colon, mu equals 64; H sub a, colon, mu is greater than 64" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext> </mtext> <mo>:</mo> <mi>μ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>64</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mtext>a</mtext> </mrow> </msub> <mtext> </mtext> <mo>:</mo> <mi>μ</mi> <mo>></mo> <mn>64</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mspace linebreak="newline"> </mspace> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
content.question: Which of the following describes a Type <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> error?

choices.label: Failing to reject the null hypothesis when the population mean is <math alttext="64" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
Failing to reject the null hypothesis when the population mean is greater than <math alttext="64" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
Rejecting the null hypothesis when the population mean is <math alttext="64" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
Rejecting the null hypothesis when the population mean is greater than <math alttext="64" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
Failing to reject the null hypothesis when the <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than the significance level

content.answer: Failing to reject the null hypothesis when the population mean is greater than <math alttext="64" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify key and relevant information to answer a question or solve a problem.
